meanings.definition: The action of making something more intense or extreme.
meanings.sent1: The intensification of the storm caused widespread damage.
meanings.sent2: The intensification of the colors made the painting more vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The intensification of the music made everyone dance faster.
meanings.sent4: The intensification of emotions turned the room into a whirlwind of feelings.
meanings.sent5: The intensification of the flavors in the dish made it unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming more intense or extreme.
meanings.sent1: The intensification of the heat made it unbearable to stay outside.
meanings.sent2: The intensification of the competition raised the stakes for all participants.
meanings.sent3: The intensification of the argument led to a surprising resolution.
meanings.sent4: The intensification of the plot in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The intensification of the pain in his leg made him seek medical attention.
